task_long_description.overview: A mobile robot navigates a corridor in Cory Hall toward a designated goal location, likely indicated by signage or a visual marker near a doorway and a QR-style poster visible in later frames. The behavior uses a brief perception step to detect a goal marker, then drives toward a named goal while retrying if motion fails. The corridor appears open with door alcoves and wall fixtures along the path, so alignment and straight-line progress are prioritized. Success is verified by reaching the goal location after approach.
preconditions: Robot is localized and map includes a named location 'goal'.
Goal marker is visible from at least one vantage point.
Drive base is operational with obstacle avoidance active.
stepwise_plan: Detect a visual goal marker to confirm heading.
If not already at the goal, navigate to the named location 'goal' with forward yaw.
Upon arrival, verify position using an 'IsAt' check.
success_criteria: The robot reports being at target 'goal'.
No collisions or prolonged timeouts during approach.
Visual context near the destination resembles the marker area.
failure_and_recovery: If detection is intermittent, retry detection up to three times.
If navigation fails or times out, retry the navigate action up to three times.
If still unsuccessful, halt and report failure for operator intervention.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the final 'IsAt(goal)' condition returns success.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Brief scan to detect a visual goal marker to orient the robot.
Navigate to the named location 'goal' with a forward-facing yaw.
Check whether the robot is currently at the goal location.

failure_modes: Marker not detected due to blur or angle.
recovery_strategy: Retry detection up to three attempts.
Retry navigation up to three attempts with planner refresh.
Stop and report if retries exhausted.
assumptions: The QR-style poster in later frames is treated as a goal marker; instruction uses a generic 'goal'.
Yaw 0 implies facing down the corridor; specific numeric target pose is abstracted by the named location.

expected_success_criteria: Final IsAt(goal) returns success after navigation.
